As we approach and celebrate your feast day, make us more aware of the goodness of God and how well He tends His garden. Instill in us your little way of doing ordinary things with extra-ordinary love. Give us the heart of a child who wonders at life and embraces everything with loving enthusiasm. Answered Prayers From This Novena

My mother taught me this novena and she prayed it only for the very most important requests. I prayed it so I would know she is in heaven. On the 8th night, which was also my 49th anniversary, and the first without my handsome husband (he died the week before Christmas), my friend dropped off an ornament of the nativity scene enclosed in a red velvet heart shaped box with a rose engraved on top! Also, during the same week, my daughter had a dream that my mother was young and beautiful with blonde hair. She did not know that there was only one time that she had dyed her hair blonde when she was about 35 and never again. Thank you St. Therese!

from D.S.

Dear Beloved Friends of St. Therese,

Please allow me to share my miracle experience with you. Ten years ago, my middle school children and I prayed the daily prayer of St. Therese while I drove them to school each morning. We prayed it for 9 days. Our Lord, Jesus, has not forgotten.

One day, a new friend from a local exercise group shared with me about the Saint and her prayer. I was privately going through a very lonely and difficult time. The nature of my work and my home life was intense and isolating. The same friend gifted me a beautiful framed piece of art that was a quote from The Little Way. Although it was considered ‚Äúunprofessional,‚Äù I hung it in my office where I saw patients daily. I decided to say the prayers for 9 days with my children hoping they would experience a real miracle. By the last day of the prayer I had forgotten about the miracle of white roses. I picked my children up that last day from their school and drove home. When we pulled into our driveway, I could see that a flower delivery had been left on the breezeway doorstep. Without remembering the prayer miracle, I walked around the corner of the breezeway to collect our delivery. At the moment I saw the bouquet of white roses on my doorstep, I almost fainted. I remembered the miracle of the prayer and so did my children! I simply could not believe my eyes. The flowers had been sent to me by another distant friend, a Jewish businesswoman, who lived in another city and had no relation to the friend who told me about St. Therese.

Several years later, a colleague visited Rome and bought me a small St. Therese laminated card that had her prayer on the backside in Latin. She said she was in the small shop in Rome and felt she should purchase the St. Therese card for me. I happily placed it in the corner of my mirror and it is still there today.

When I later moved from my city, I purchased a new home on the coast of Alabama. A few months later, the new rose bushes planted by the builder began to bloom. The roses that bloomed were all white across my front porch. Curiously, a single pink rose blooms from the white rose bushes each spring and fall. There are no pink rose bushes planted there. Every other bloom from the same bush is white, that is, the single pink rose is blooming from a white rose bush. I‚Äôm not sure what it means, but I know in my heart that it is related to that prayer.

Our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ never forgets us or the prayers we lift through Him to our Father.

I saw this website and wanted to share this amazing miracle with you all to encourage you.

Many blessings to you from the coast of Alabama,

from K.D.
